humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a measurement of the largest tumor size, which is 2.2 cm. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is stated as 2.2 cm (7 cm in some parts of the report, which seems to be a typo) in the 'Synoptic Report - Breast' section. Therefore, the T stage is T2, as T1 is for tumors up to 2 cm. I did not consider substaging information as requested.
